Authors:
Kenichi Nonaka, Takahiro Ishii, Kazuro Shiomi, Satoshi
Omura, Rokuro Masuma
Title:
Virgaria reniformis, a new hyphomycete (Xylariaceae) from
soils in the Bonin Islands, Japan
Keywords:
Anamorph Â· Cellulose plate Â· New species Â· Oceanic
island Â· Phylogeny
Abstract:
Virgaria reniformis, a new hyphomycete classified in the
Xylariaceae (Ascomycota) was isolated from soils in the Bonin Islands,
Japan. It is characterized by olive grey colonies and solitary,
reniform, light brown sympodial conidia. Morphologically, the species is
similar to V. nigra, but it is different from V. nigra in phylogeny and
also differs with length of terminally integrated conidiogenous
cells.
